Key Match Events: Yamamoto gave up back-to-back singles to Kyle Higashioka and Luis Arraez in the third inning but induced Fernando Tatis to hit into an inning-ending double play and retired the last seven batters he faced
Darvish pitched several strong innings, but he gave up solo home runs to Enrique Hernandez and Teoscar Hernandez
Teoscar Hernandez launched a 420-foot blast into the left field seats in the seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers, the 2020 World Series champions, are back in the league championship series for the first time since 2021.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Japanese superstar Shohei Ohtani will have a chance to battle for a World Series berth.
Yamamoto, who struggled during his team's game-one win, was dialed in. He gave up two hits over five innings with one walk and two strikeouts, throwing 63 pitches -- 39 of them strikes.
